page.title: 18DRYING HOPS,WOODSTON FARM
page.content: AT THE HOP MACHINE 4 MEN WERE CLIPPING THE HOPS ON TO A BELT. THE HOPS WENT TO A LADY WHO CUT OFF THOSE THAT WERE TOO LONG. THEN THE HOPS WENT INTO THE ROLLERS. THE ROLLERS SEPARATED THE HOPS FROM THE LEAVES AND BINES, WHICH WENT OFF ON A CONVEYOR BELT. THE HOPS WENT ON A SEPARATE BELT TO THE KILNS TO BE DRIED. THE KILNS HAD SLATTED FLOORS WITH MESH ON TOP.THE HOPS ARE IN THERE FOR 11 HOURS. THEY START OFF AT 90 DEGREES AND IN 3 HOURS IT SLOWLY RISES TO 140 DEGREES. WHEN THE RISE IN THE TEMPERATURE WAS TAKING PLACE IT WAS DONE AUTOMATICALLY.IN THE KILN THERE WERE NETS WITH HOPS ON. THE KILNS WERE HEATED BY BURNERS UNDERNEATH.
